summary: Email correspondence between Assistant United States Attorney (USANYS) and defense attorney Sigrid McCawley regarding scheduling the trial date in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. McCawley conveys a witness's preference for an early September trial date due to an impending adoption with a baby due in early November.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP representing Ghislaine Maxwell, communicating with the prosecution about trial scheduling and witness availability.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN/AIN).

connections.description: McCawley is a defense attorney representing Maxwell in the criminal case.

events.title: Trial Scheduling Communication
events.description: Email exchange regarding setting the trial date for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, with the defense conveying a witness's preference for an early September date.

events.title: Expected Birth of Adopted Baby
events.description: A witness (name redacted) and her husband are expecting to adopt a baby, with the birth mother due in early November.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain about scheduling the trial in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.
A witness (name redacted) prefers an early September 2021 trial date due to an impending adoption with a baby due in early November.
Sigrid McCawley of Boies Schiller Flexner LLP is acting as defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell.
The correspondence shows coordination between the prosecution and defense regarding witness availability and trial logistics.
